newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: SOCCER-PORTO IN RECORD PORTUGUESE LEAGUE TITLE WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PORTO IN RECORD PORTUGUESE LEAGUE TITLE WIN.

text.p: Porto clinched the Portuguese first division title for a record third successive season when they beat Guimaraes 4-0 away on Saturday.
The win left the northern team 11 points clear of second-placed Sporting, who cannot catch Porto with only three matches to go. Porto have won the championship 16 times.
Sporting beat Salgueiros 3-0 away on Friday.
Two goals each from Brazilian striker Mario Jardel and Slovenian Zlatko Zahovic sealed Porto's historic victory and filled the streets of Oporto with hundreds of cheering fans.
Zahovic, unmarked inside the box, opened the scoring in the 24th minute by converting a right cross from Sergio Conceicao, who also set up Jardel's 60th minute header which took Porto 2-0 ahead.
Five minutes later Jardel got his second goal on the rebound after a 20-metre freekick from Jose Barroso. It was Jardel's 28th goal this season and left him as top league scorer.
A solo effort from Zahovic secured Porto's final goal in the 69th minute.
